description: The Olympic Games are one of the most prestigious and celebrated sporting events in the world, with a rich history dating back to ancient Greece. They have evolved from their origins as a religious festival dedicated to Zeus into a global event that promotes unity, sportsmanship, and excellence. relation: Olympic Games --[Revived By]-> Pierre de Coubertin--description:The modern Olympic Games were revived by Pierre de Coubertin.-- relation: Pierre de Coubertin --[Promoted]-> Peace and Understanding Among Nations--description:Pierre de Coubertin believed that sport could promote peace and understanding among nations.-- name: Zeus

description: Pierre de Coubertin was a French educator and historian who is credited with reviving the Olympic Games in the late 19th century. relation: Olympic Games --[Dedicated To]-> Zeus--description:The ancient Olympic Games were a religious festival dedicated to Zeus.-- relation: Olympic Games --[Include Sports Such As]-> Athletics, Swimming, Snowboarding, Beach Volleyball--description:The Olympic Games include a wide range of sports, from traditional events like athletics and swimming to newer additions like snowboarding and beach volleyball.-- relation: Olympic Games --[Have Been Hosted By]-> Various Cities Around the World--description:The Olympic Games have been hosted by various cities around the world.-- name: Political Issues, Doping Scandals

description: The modern Olympic Games are a major international multi-sport event held every four years. They were first held in Athens, Greece, in 1896. name: Modern Olympic Games

description: The Olympic Games are a major international multi-sport event held every four years, featuring summer and winter sports. name: ancient Olympic Games
type: Sporting Event
description: The ancient Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in honor of the Greek god Zeus. They began in 776 BC and continued for nearly 12 centuries until they were abolished by the Roman Emperor Theodosius in 393 AD.
